# Robust Analysis with Error Handling
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
from scipy.stats import ttest_ind

# 1. Load and Clean Data
file_path = 'abfss://bigdata-project@nutritionedudatalake.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/nutrition_data/Nutrition__Physical_Activity__and_Obesity_-_Behavioral_Risk_Factor_Surveillance_System.csv'
try:
    df = pd.read_csv(file_path)
    
    # Apply filters with data validation
    nutrition_df = df[
        (df['Class'] == 'Fruits and Vegetables') & 
        (df['StratificationCategory1'] == 'Education') &
        (df['Question'].str.contains('less than one time daily', case=False, na=False))
    ].copy()
    
    # Convert to numeric and drop invalid
    nutrition_df['Data_Value'] = pd.to_numeric(nutrition_df['Data_Value'], errors='coerce')
    nutrition_df['Sample_Size'] = pd.to_numeric(nutrition_df['Sample_Size'], errors='coerce')
    nutrition_df.dropna(subset=['Data_Value', 'Sample_Size', 'Stratification1'], inplace=True)
    
    if nutrition_df.empty:
        raise ValueError("No valid data after filtering!")

    # 2. Weighted Averages
    def weighted_avg(group):
        vals = group['Data_Value']
        weights = group['Sample_Size']
        return np.average(vals, weights=weights)
    
    summary = nutrition_df.groupby('Stratification1').apply(weighted_avg) \
                         .reset_index(name='Weighted Avg %') \
                         .sort_values('Weighted Avg %', ascending=False)

    # 3. Statistical Testing
    groups = {
        level: nutrition_df[nutrition_df['Stratification1'] == level]['Data_Value'] 
        for level in summary['Stratification1']
    }
    
    if len(groups) >= 2:
        t_stat, p_value = ttest_ind(list(groups.values())[0], list(groups.values())[-1])
        sig_flag = f"âœ… (p = {p_value:.4f})" if p_value < 0.05 else f"âŒ (p = {p_value:.4f})"
    else:
        raise ValueError("Insufficient groups for comparison")

    # 4. Visualization (Fixed Seaborn Warning)
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax = sns.barplot(
        data=summary,
        x='Weighted Avg %',
        y='Stratification1',
        hue='Stratification1',  # Fixes palette warning
        palette='RdYlGn_r',
        legend=False
    )
    
    # Add value labels
    for i, val in enumerate(summary['Weighted Avg %']):
        ax.text(val + 1, i, f"{val:.1f}%", va='center')

    plt.title('Low Fruit/Vegetable Consumption by Education Level\n(Weighted by Sample Size | â–¼ = Better)')
    plt.xlabel('% Reporting <1x Daily Consumption')
    plt.ylabel('Education Level')
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.show()

    # 5. Key Metrics
    national_avg = weighted_avg(nutrition_df)
    print("ðŸ” Valid Groups:", summary['Stratification1'].tolist())
    print(f"ðŸ“Š National Average: {national_avg:.1f}%")
    print(f"âš ï¸ Worst Group: {summary.iloc[0]['Stratification1']} ({summary.iloc[0]['Weighted Avg %']:.1f}%)")
    print(f"âœ… Best Group: {summary.iloc[-1]['Stratification1']} ({summary.iloc[-1]['Weighted Avg %']:.1f}%)")
    print(f"ðŸ“‰ Gap: {summary.iloc[0]['Weighted Avg %'] - summary.iloc[-1]['Weighted Avg %']:.1f} pp")
    print(f"ðŸ§ª Significance: {sig_flag}")

except Exception as e:
    print(f"ðŸš¨ Error: {str(e)}")
    print("ðŸ’¡ Debug Tips:")
    print("- Check if 'StratificationCategory1' contains 'Education' values")
    print("- Verify numeric columns don't contain non-numeric values")
    print("- Ensure sample sizes > 0 for weighted calculations")
